topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1981–1988, Volume XLI, Global Issues II
topic.body: This volume is part of a Foreign Relations subseries that documents the foreign policy decision making of the Reagan administration. Diplomatic issues presented in this volume include: response to the AIDS epidemic, debate on international population, disaster relief in underdeveloped countries, changes in human rights policy, the Law of the Sea Treaty, and global efforts to protect the ozone layer and curb whaling practices.
